    • Constructor Detail

      • Client

        public Client()
        Default constructor. Does not accept any parameters.

      • Client

        public Client(long clientId,
              java.lang.String firstName,
              java.lang.String lastName,
              java.lang.String address,
              java.lang.String postalCode,
              java.lang.String phoneNumber,
              char clientType)
       throws InvalidPhoneNumberException,
              InvalidPostalCodeException
        Constructors that accepts 7 parameters to create the client.
        Parameters:
        clientId - is a long for the client's id.
        firstName - is a String for the client's first name.
        lastName - is a String for the client's last name.
        address - is a String for the client's address.
        postalCode - is a String for the client's postal code.
        phoneNumber - is a String for the client's phone #.
        clientType - is a char for the client's type. R = residential, C = commercial and B = both.
        Throws:
        InvalidPhoneNumberException - for phone number format
        InvalidPostalCodeException - for postalCode

      • Client

        public Client(java.lang.String line)
       throws InvalidPhoneNumberException,
              InvalidPostalCodeException
        Constructor that accepts a line (String) that contains the attributes needed to create a client. The format must be in: "id firstName lastName address postalCode phoneNumber clientType"
        Parameters:
        line - a String representing the Client information
        Throws:
        InvalidPhoneNumberException - for phone number format
        InvalidPostalCodeException - for postal code format

    • Method Detail

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Method to display attributes in desired format.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Client c)
        Method to compare two clients. If they are the same client then equals will return true. If they are not the same client then equals will return false.
        Parameters:
        c - is a Client object to be compared
        Returns:
        A boolean. If the client's have the same id number than true is returned. If the clients have a different id then false is returned.

      • validatePostalCode

        private void validatePostalCode(java.lang.String pc)
                         throws InvalidPostalCodeException
        Method to validate the postal code. Must be in format A9A 9A9. Will throw an exception if it is not in this format.
        Parameters:
        pc - is the postal code as a String
        Throws:
        InvalidPostalCodeException - when the format is incorrect.

      • validatePhoneNumber

        private void validatePhoneNumber(java.lang.String pn)
                          throws InvalidPhoneNumberException
        Method to validate the phone number. Must be in format 111-111-1111. Will throw an exception if it is not in this format.
        Parameters:
        pn - is the phone number as a String
        Throws:
        InvalidPhoneNumberException - is thrown when it is not in the proper format.
